author: Reuters Editorial
title: PRESS DIGEST- Canada-May 10
text:
May 10 (Reuters) - The following are the top stories from selected Canadian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
THE GLOBE AND MAIL ** Just weeks before a decision on whether to cancel construction of the Trans Mountain pipeline expansion, Kinder Morgan Inc shareholders voted on Wednesday to demand audits of the company's environmental and legal risks. tgam.ca/2Idq2Li
** In a white paper to be published on Thursday, Ontario Chartered Professional Accountants implores the province's accountants to "act with objectivity and professional skepticism" when dealing with cryptocurrencies and to avoid working with any initial coin offerings that don't treat their underlying tokens as securities. tgam.ca/2I7xZ4A
NATIONAL POST ** Despite WestJet Airlines Ltd management's attempts to alleviate concerns about execution risk, analysts across the board slashed the company's year-end stock price targets by several dollars as shares hovered below $20 on Wednesday, a year-to-date drop of more than 25 percent. bit.ly/2I9HMHb
** Torstar Corp plans to charge readers for online news once more in its latest strategy to recover after the internet disrupted the newspaper industry. bit.ly/2IcESl7 (Compiled by Bengaluru newsroom)
